node.title: Water.org UTSC x BTO Winter/Holiday Event

content.value: We collaborate with Water.org UTSC to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world. More can be seen on our social media links.

childMarkdownRemark.html: We collaborate with Water.org UTSC to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.

content.value: November 2020 at BTO was highlighted by two initiatives we were able to complete amid the difficult circumstances posed by the COVID-19 Pandemic.

We completed a food distribution initiative this month to distribute 10 packs of 60 donuts to the homeless across Toronto. One of our stops was to a homeless shelter at the Warden Woods Community Centre.
To help out local small businesses during the hardships of the COVID-19 pandemic, we decided to help promote an example of one through our social media! Members of BTO worked with the owner of
to take a professional photo shoot and make posters to promote their business!

childMarkdownRemark.html: In November 2020, still amid the COVID-19 Pandemic, BTO engaged in a donut distribution initiative while also helping to promote a local small business.

content.value: October 2020 for BTO will be remembered for two events that we organized for the UTSC community.
We started off the Fall semester by organizing an open giveaway for a $20 Amazon gift card and Blankets for TO membership.

In the spirit of Halloween and as a destressor after exams, we hosted a pumpkin carving competition open to all UTSC students. Students were able to socialize and have a good time while competing between each other to carve the coolest pumpkin they could. The pumpkins carved were awesome! Thanks to all those who participated!

childMarkdownRemark.html: In October, BTO hosted a pumpkin carving contest for UTSC students and giveaway.

content.value: Given the ever-present circumstances of the COVID-19 pandemic, the meet and greet for the start of the Fall 2020 term at UTSC moved online to Zoom. We introduced BTO and shared our vision to UTSC students and prospective members.

It was also at this time that we further extended our social media presence. You can now reach us over Facebook (Blankets for T. O. - UTSC), Instagram (@blanketsforto) and Tiktok (@blanketsforto)! All these links, and more, can be found on the Contact page of our site.

childMarkdownRemark.html: BTO held a meet and greet over Zoom at the start of the Fall term to introduce ourselves to the community!

content.value: To mark Valentine's Day, BTO members organized a blanket distribution! We embarked on a 5 kilometre journey around downtown Toronto and distributed thermal blankets to the homeless. The weather was cold, but we remained warm and friendly! Money earned through membership fees and donations to BTO will go towards purchasing blankets for future blanket distributions like this one!

childMarkdownRemark.html: Read about how BTO members distributed blankets in downtown Toronto on a chilly Valentine's Day.

content.value: BTO successfully hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community. First of all, thank you to all those students that were able to take the time to come! It was amazing to see and meet all of you. The agenda of the session was to inform students about how they could contribute to BTO, including how they could become a member, apply for more senior positions, donate to the cause, and become a volunteer at future events.
Looking forward to working with the community! For those who were not able to attend, do not worry, we will have plenty of updates through our social media and website!

childMarkdownRemark.html: BTO hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community.
